s.text: You wonder why no one has ever tried this before.
You wonder why no one has ever tried this before.
"I can't tell you the number of taboos it violated.

And if the editors are ever tempted to take themselves too seriously, they can always refer to Lisa Carver's hilarious essay on the differences between "sensualists" and "sexualists"--those who like talking about it and those who like doing it.
The recently launched "literate smut" Webzine Nerve might be Sex Site No.
The recently launched "literate smut" Webzine Nerve might be Sex Site No.
The recently launched "literate smut" Webzine Nerve might be Sex Site No.

Though the author of Advertisements for Myself has always liked his sex the way a schoolboy likes his pie--any way he can get it--he was never the hippest cat in the pack (witness "The White Negro," his attempt to grapple with the Beats, which proved the adage that those who had to ask what hip was, weren't).
